intro: Physaria cordiformis, commonly known as the heart-shaped sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are succulent, adapted to arid environments. Physaria cordiformis typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert regions. It is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within one growing season.
